name: Peppermint Black Bean Brownie Bites
description: Chocolate brownie bites have extra chocolate chips, pure peppermint extract, are made with black beans and topped with crushed candy canes. These are the perfect Christmas treat!
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cup black beans (1-15 oz can), drained and rinsed
3 tablespoons full fat coconut milk (shake the can before opening, use the creamy stuff)
1/2 cup non-dairy chocolate chips (mini or regular)

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, mix together the ground flax and water. Set aside to thicken.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, mix together the ground flax and water. Set aside to thicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly grease a mini-muffin pan (or regular sized muffin pan). I sprayed very lightly with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly grease a mini-muffin pan (or regular sized muffin pan). I sprayed very lightly with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the drained and rinsed black beans and the rest of the ingredients (except for the chocolate chips and crushed candy canes). Puree for a couple of minutes, scraping the sides as necessary to get it all smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the drained and rinsed black beans and the rest of the ingredients (except for the chocolate chips and crushed candy canes). Puree for a couple of minutes, scraping the sides as necessary to get it all smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the chocolate chips and stir them in by hand.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the chocolate chips and stir them in by hand.

recipeInstructions.text: Evenly distribute the mixture into muffin pan. Fill about 3/4 of the way full for a mini-muffin pan, or about 1/2 full if you are using a regular muffin pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Evenly distribute the mixture into muffin pan. Fill about 3/4 of the way full for a mini-muffin pan, or about 1/2 full if you are using a regular muffin pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the tops look dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the tops look dry.

recipeInstructions.text: Let cool for about 30 minutes before removing them from the pan. Then sprinkle with crushed candy cane pieces. They will be very soft and fudgy.
recipeInstructions.name: Let cool for about 30 minutes before removing them from the pan. Then sprinkle with crushed candy cane pieces. They will be very soft and fudgy.

recipeInstructions.text: Store in an airtight container for a couple of days, or they will keep for up to a week in the fridge.
recipeInstructions.name: Store in an airtight container for a couple of days, or they will keep for up to a week in the fridge.
